t: Mark 4
The Parable of the Sower
And*p again He began to teach by the sea. And a great multitude was gathered to Him, so that He got into a boat and sat in*i it*i on the sea; and the whole multitude was on the land facing the sea.
Then He taught them many things by parables, and said to them in His teaching:
“Listen!*rp Behold,*r a*r sower*r went*r out*r to*r sow.*r
And*r it*r happened,*r as*r he*r sowed,*r that*ir some*r seed*ir fell*r by*r the*r wayside;*r and*r the*r birds*r of*r the*r air*r came*r and*r devoured*r it.*r
Some*r fell*r on*r stony*r ground,*r where*r it*r did*r not*r have*r much*r earth;*r and*r immediately*r it*r sprang*r up*r because*r it*r had*r no*r depth*r of*r earth.*r
But*r when*r the*r sun*r was*r up*r it*r was*r scorched,*r and*r because*r it*r had*r no*r root*r it*r withered*r away.*r
And*r some*r seed*ir fell*r among*r thorns;*r and*r the*r thorns*r grew*r up*r and*r choked*r it,*r and*r it*r yielded*r no*r crop.*r
But*r other*r seed*ir fell*r on*r good*r ground*r and*r yielded*r a*r crop*r that*r sprang*r up,*r increased*r and*r produced:*r some*r thirtyfold,*r some*r sixty,*r and*r some*r a*r hundred.”*r
And*p He said to them, “He*r who*r has*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear!”*r
The Purpose of Parables
But*p when He was alone, those around Him with the twelve asked Him about the parable.

And He said to them, “To*r you*r it*r has*r been*r given*r to*r know*r the*r mystery*r of*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God;*r but*r to*r those*r who*r are*r outside,*r all*r things*r come*r in*r parables,*r

so*r that*r ‘Seeing*rpn they*r may*r see*r and*r not*r perceive,*r And*rld hearing*r they*r may*r hear*r and*r not*r understand;*r Lest*rld they*r should*r turn,*r And*rld their*ir sins*r be*r forgiven*r them.’”*r
The Parable of the Sower Explained
And*p He said to them, “Do*r you*r not*r understand*r this*r parable?*r How*r then*r will*r you*r understand*r all*r the*r parables?*r
The*r sower*r sows*r the*r word.*r

And*r these*r are*r the*r ones*r by*r the*r wayside*r where*r the*r word*r is*r sown.*r When*r they*r hear,*r Satan*r comes*r immediately*r and*r takes*r away*r the*r word*r that*r was*r sown*r in*r their*r hearts.*r
These*r likewise*r are*r the*r ones*r sown*r on*r stony*r ground*r who,*r when*r they*r hear*r the*r word,*r immediately*r receive*r it*r with*r gladness;*r

and*r they*r have*r no*r root*r in*r themselves,*r and*r so*r endure*r only*r for*r a*r time.*r Afterward,*r when*r tribulation*r or*r persecution*r arises*r for*r the*r word’s*r sake,*r immediately*r they*r stumble.*r
Now*r these*r are*r the*r ones*r sown*r among*r thorns;*r they*ir are*ir the*r ones*r who*r hear*r the*r word,*r
and*r the*r cares*r of*r this*r world,*r the*r deceitfulness*r of*r riches,*r and*r the*r desires*r for*r other*r things*r entering*r in*r choke*r the*r word,*r and*r it*r becomes*r unfruitful.*r

But*r these*r are*r the*r ones*r sown*r on*r good*r ground,*r those*r who*r hear*r the*r word,*r accept*r it,*ir and*r bear*r fruit:*r some*r thirtyfold,*r some*r sixty,*r and*r some*r a*r hundred.”*r
Light Under a Basket
Also*p He said to them, “Is*r a*r lamp*r brought*r to*r be*r put*r under*r a*r basket*r or*r under*r a*r bed?*r Is*r it*r not*r to*r be*r set*r on*r a*r lampstand?*r
For*r there*r is*r nothing*r hidden*r which*r will*r not*r be*r revealed,*r nor*r has*r anything*r been*r kept*r secret*r but*r that*r it*r should*r come*r to*r light.*r
If*r anyone*r has*r ears*r to*r hear,*r let*r him*r hear.”*r

Then*p He said to them, “Take*r heed*r what*r you*r hear.*r With*r the*r same*r measure*r you*r use,*r it*r will*r be*r measured*r to*r you;*r and*r to*r you*r who*r hear,*r more*r will*r be*r given.*r
For*r whoever*r has,*r to*r him*r more*r will*r be*r given;*r but*r whoever*r does*r not*r have,*r even*r what*r he*r has*r will*r be*r taken*r away*r from*r him.”*r
The Parable of the Growing Seed
And*p He said, “The*r kingdom*r of*r God*r is*r as*r if*r a*r man*r should*r scatter*r seed*r on*r the*r ground,*r
and*r should*r sleep*r by*r night*r and*r rise*r by*r day,*r and*r the*r seed*r should*r sprout*r and*r grow,*r he*r himself*r does*r not*r know*r how.*r
For*r the*r earth*r yields*r crops*r by*r itself:*r first*r the*r blade,*r then*r the*r head,*r after*r that*r the*r full*r grain*r in*r the*r head.*r
But*r when*r the*r grain*r ripens,*r immediately*r he*r puts*r in*r the*r sickle,*r because*r the*r harvest*r has*r come.”*r
The Parable of the Mustard Seed
Then*p He said, “To*r what*r shall*r we*r liken*r the*r kingdom*r of*r God?*r Or*r with*r what*r parable*r shall*r we*r picture*r it?*r
It*ir is*ir like*r a*r mustard*r seed*r which,*r when*r it*r is*r sown*r on*r the*r ground,*r is*r smaller*r than*r all*r the*r seeds*r on*r earth;*r

but*r when*r it*r is*r sown,*r it*r grows*r up*r and*r becomes*r greater*r than*r all*r herbs,*r and*r shoots*r out*r large*r branches,*r so*r that*r the*r birds*r of*r the*r air*r may*r nest*r under*r its*r shade.”*r
Jesus’ Use of Parables
And*p with many such parables He spoke the word to them as they were able to hear it.*i
But without a parable He did not speak to them. And when they were alone, He explained all things to His disciples.
Wind and Wave Obey Jesus
On*p the same day, when evening had come, He said to them, “Let*r us*r cross*r over*r to*r the*r other*r side.”*r
Now when they had left the multitude, they took Him along in the boat as He was. And other little boats were also with Him.
And a great windstorm arose, and the waves beat into the boat, so that it was already filling.
But He was in the stern, asleep on a pillow. And they awoke Him and said to Him, “Teacher, do You not care that we are perishing?”
Then*p He arose and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, “Peace,*r be*r still!”*r And the wind ceased and there was a great calm.
But He said to them, “Why*r are*r you*r so*r fearful?*r How*r is*ir it*ir that*r you*r have*r no*r faith?”*r
And they feared exceedingly, and said to one another, “Who can this be, that even the wind and the sea obey Him!”
